sections.title: BOOK INITIAL ASSESSMENT AND CONSULTATION
sections.content: Discuss the patient's weight loss goals, lifestyle factors, dietary habits, physical activity levels, and readiness for treatment.

sections.title: PATIENT EDUCATION AND COUNSELING
sections.content: Educate the patient about Compound Semaglutide, its mechanism of action, and its role in weight management.

sections.title: INITIATION OF COMPOUND SEMAGLUTIDE TREATMENT
sections.content: Prescribe Compound Semaglutide according to the recommended dosing schedule, typically starting with a low dose and titrating up gradually to the maintenance dose.

sections.title: HOW TO DRAW AND INJECT SEMAGLUTIDE?
content: Semaglutide is administered subcutaneously via a small injection. These injections are only to be administered once a week.
PLEASE WATCH THIS HELPFUL YOUTUBE VIDEO
on how to properly prepare yourself and administer an injection:

instructions: Remove plastic safety cap. You can discard this cap.
Clean top of the vial with an alcohol wipe.
Uncap the syringe (usually orange in color). Syringes are often capped on both ends (needle and plunger side).
Pierce the rubber top with syringe.
Pull back on the plunger of syringe and fill to appropriate dose. Please note, the dose on the syringe is in 'units'.
Clean injection site with alcohol swab.
Remove needle, recap, and dispose of needle.
